results.title: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maurie Gervasoni’s grandfather settled in Newstead during the Victorian gold rush in the 1860’s and quickly designed and built a family estate. A love of music and dancing made the Yandoit houses a destination for vibrant country living. The stone house and former stables presently sit as a relic, but Maurie hopes that one day the place will be restored to its former glory.

results.title: Theatre Royal: Castlemaine
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: A Castlemaine icon, the Theatre Royal is one of the oldest theatres in the country dating back to 1858. The owner in 2010, the projectionist, a burlesque performer and a local regular patron talk about their cinematic experiences, the history of the building, its architectural delights and how it is a major social centre for the town. Changing with the times, this is not only a single screen cinema, it offers music nights, community events, artist markets and even boasts a theatre ghost.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

results.title: Game Masters: Warren Spector interview
results.creator_credit: Dean Robb, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Warren Spector speaks about his career as a videogame designer. Warren refers to his days of playing ‘Dungeons and Dragons’ and the influence this has had on him as a vidoegames designer. A great collector of board games and Disney memorabilia, Warren talks with great passion about the importance of archiving and making games a medium worth recognising.

Warren Spector is a master of role playing game design and has been influenced and inspired by films and literature, such as ‘Blade Runner’ and cyberpunk science fiction, he is best known for creating influential titles such as ‘Deus Ex’ and his most recent release, ‘Disney Epic Mickey’.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: The Greta Bunyip Newsletter
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: In the digital age it’s all well and good for those who are connected via high speed internet, but in some rural towns it is the good old fashioned newsletter that keeps locals in the know. The Bunyip Newsletter is hand-delivered across the wider Greta area by six committed volunteers. We meet Noeleen Lloyd and Allan Porker as well as local historian Joan Ellis and hear about the importance of having a local newsletter. ‘The Bunyip’ was born out of a demand from the locals to be better informed and more connected to their community and surrounds. Over 300 newsletters are distributed every two months containing articles of historical, sporting and community importance.

results.title: The Newstead Swimming Pool
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Newstead Pool is an important hub of this Victorian town and a community hang-out that gets very lively in the summer. It is run by more than 50 volunteers and is a place for the community to gather and socialise, and has also been known for a sneaky skinny dip.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

results.title: Game Masters: in conversation with Warren Spector
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Public Programs and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description:
Join Warren Spector, master of role playing game design, as he explores the ideas that have changed the gaming industry.
Spector is known for creating influential titles such as ‘System Shock’, ‘Deus Ex’, ‘Ultima Underworld’ and ‘Thief: The Dark Project’. His most recent release, ‘Disney Epic Mickey’, has been hailed as the embodiment of his renowned philosophy on videogame design.
This interview is a rare opportunity to hear from an industry legend, who has irrefutably influenced videogame theory and design. Filmed as part of the ACMI ‘Game Masters’ exhibtion 2012.

results.title: Rose Hill: life on a string
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rose is a 90-year-old woman whose passion in life is puppetry, her studio in Mildura is filled with thousands of puppets, showcasing her family’s life long work. Rose introduced puppets to her four sons as a way to enhance their learning; this started a fascination for her son Ross, who became a world renowned puppeteer, working with Jim Henson on the film ‘Labyrinth’. Rose is an inspirational and vibrant woman who is still active in her community.

results.title: Game Masters: Phill Ring and Jonathan Smith interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
At its inception, TT Games acquired the worldwide rights to LEGO games and began combining the versatility and imagination of LEGO with one of cinema’s more popular worlds to create ‘LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame’ (2005). The unlikely combination of LEGO, ‘Star Wars’ and puzzle-solving gameplay was a surprise hit, garnering acclaim not usually attributed to children’s games.

Continuing the LEGO series, TT Games branched out into a variety of well-known film franchises, including ‘Batman’ and ‘Harry Potter’, creating many entertaining, humorous and beloved titles. With each new title there was an emphasis on improving the formula with new puzzles, gameplay and features.

Producer Phillip Ring and Head of Production, Jonathan Smith, discuss ‘LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame’ series, ‘LEGO Batman: The Videogame’ and ‘LEGO Harry Potter: Years 1-4 & 5-7’.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
